“This place,” You ask, following Nel into the living quarters. “Did it look like anyone's been here rescently?”

“Nope.” Nel nods. “Pristine. Looks like there's a couple of little places. This one looks like a lady's room. Frilly... bunch of empty portraits.”

“Empty...” The room is dark, with a lace-curtained canopy bed occupying the majority of the floor space. You're still stuck on the dusty memento—did no one believe you when you said you were cursed? Maybe it's because you didn't go out of your way to make it seem like a game thing. It -feels- real enough, though you're not exactly sure how you would go about describing it.

“Ah, I recognize that one.” Aelriss says, pointing to a picture mounted above the canopy. “It's tbe background from one of the pictures we took from the tomb. There was a woman in the one I had, though...”

“You have more art from this place?” Ayla asks. “Could I take a look at it?”

“Well, I already sold it when we went back to town...” Aeriss shrugs.

“You... sold it?” Ayla looks distraught.

“Yeah? People are just gonna put the stuff in their houses.” Aelriss says. “You can just buy it back later... it's probably not going anywhere. Besides, you guys basically run the city...”

“I'll have you know that roles in the Alliance guilds are about responsibility.” Dorian interjects. “There's more to it than merely—“

“We've already heard it, Dorian.” You say. “Please.”

What will you do?
